table.caption: Elf (Non-drow) Adventurer Story Hooks
rows: You believe the key to reuniting the elves with Corellon lies somewhere in the wider world, not within elven society, and you're determined to find it.
Your sibling was killed by a rampaging monster. You won't rest until you track it down and slay it.
A raven brought you a cryptic message from an old friend who needs your help, but the message was vague about the friend's location. You're trying to follow a years-old trail and save your friend.
A beautiful elf won your heart, then broke it. If you earn enough gold and glory by adventuring, perhaps you can win back your love.
Your father thought you too weak to survive as an adventurer, but he's wrong, and you'll prove it.
Only those who perform great deeds are remembered long after their death. Bards will honor your exploits for generations to come.
You're secretly in love with one of the other members of your adventuring group, and you can't bear the thought of any harm befalling that person.
When you were born, your grandmother prophesied you would one day rule a human kingdom. You've gone in search of that destiny.
table.name: Elf Tables; Elf (Non-drow) Adventurer Story Hooks

table.caption: Drow Adventurer Story Hooks
rows: You overheard members of your own house plotting to poison you, so you fled from the Underdark to save yourself. You won't return until you've amassed enough fortune to surround yourself with loyal mercenary bodyguards.
You were enslaved as punishment for trying to poison an influential rival, but you escaped and fled to the surface. If you return to the Underdark and are captured, you'll be re-enslaved.
You were the lover of a high-ranking priestess of Lolth as a means of enhancing your status. When she tired of you, the loss of status was humiliating, so you left.

You killed a drow from a more powerful house in a duel over a public insult. The slain drow's house vowed to destroy your house unless you were handed over. Your kin urged you to leave the Underdark. You wonder what became of them.

A close friend of yours was revealed to be a worshiper of Eilistraee. Suspicion fell on everyone in her circle. Running was a tacit admission of guilt, even though you knew nothing about it, but you'd have been sacrificed to Lolth if you stayed.

You were among a group of surface raiders that was ambushed, and you were captured. During years of captivity, you learned that most of what Lolth's priestesses taught about the outer world was lies. Now you're experiencing the truth for yourself.

All your life, you were alienated and terrified by the cruelty of your kin. The first chance you got, you volunteered to go on a surface raid, then deserted the group and remained behind. Now you're hated and feared wherever you go, but at least you've found a small group of adventurous friends who trust and support each other.

You were part of a delegation carrying diplomatic messages to another drow city when duergar attacked the caravan for slaves and treasure. Only you and one other guard escaped. If you'd returned home, you'd have been poisoned or worse for failure. Becoming a mercenary was your best option.
table.name: Elf Tables; Drow Adventurer Story Hooks

Items taken from surface world in raids

table.caption: Dwarf Adventurer Story Hooks
rows: You were accused of stealing a fellow artisan's item and claiming it as your work. Innocent or guilty, you were made an outcast.
Your wanderlust prompted you to shirk your duties as a crafter in favor of wandering the world. Your clan isn't pleased with this choice.
You became separated from your clan due to an earthquake, a drow slave raid, or similar event and hope to return home.
You were assigned to become a merchant by the priests of Moradin and have yet to forgive them for their mistake. You should be working a forge, not wandering the outside world!
You are a spy, traveling incognito to gather information for the clan elders.
You struggle to resist the lure of Abbathor, but can't hold it at bay. Better to walk the world and sate your greed on non-dwarves.
table.name: Dwarves in the World; Dwarf Adventurer Story Hooks

table.caption: Dwarf Quirks
rows: Water from the sky! It always surprises you.
You have a fascination with the ocean and its chaos.
Any creature larger than a human makes you nervous.
You prefer to travel with a parasol or similar item that puts a comforting shelter over your head.
You prefer to sleep during the day.
You speak Common or any other non-dwarf language only if you must.
For you, relaxation is putting in a day at the forge.
You avoid contact with other dwarves, since you mistrust those who would leave their strongholds.
table.name: Dwarves in the World; Dwarf Quirks

Conducts trade with the City of Brass

table.caption: Duergar Adventurer Story Hooks
rows: You are a heretic, drawn to worship of Moradin.
Caught stealing, you escaped imprisonment but not before torture left you with a scar or lasting injury.
You were enslaved by drow or mind flayers but escaped to the surface.
You seek only to test yourself in battle with monsters.
Profit is all that matters to you.
The best way to defeat the folk of the surface is to study them firsthand.
table.name: Duergar in the World; Duergar Adventurer Story Hooks

table.caption: Duergar Quirks
rows: A separate personality in your mind provides advice and guidance to you.
Your gear must be perfectly arranged, otherwise someone must bleed.
When there isn't a roof over your head, you keep your eyes on the ground.
You don't talk unless you absolutely must.
The outside world is a giant cave, and nothing will convince you otherwise.
Humans fascinate you, and you collect odd trinkets of their culture.
table.name: Duergar in the World; Duergar Quirks

table.caption: Githyanki Personality Traits
rows: When I'm bored I make my own excitement, and I'm always bored.
I treat others as if they were animals that simply don't know any better.
Violence is a spice that makes life worth living.
Old age is a concept that I find fascinating. Maybe someday I too will be aged.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githyanki Personality Traits

table.caption: Githyanki Ideals
rows: Fidelity. Warriors are only as good as the vows they keep.
Power. The weak rule the strong.
Duty. It is by Vlaakith's will alone that I act.
Freedom. No strong soul should be enslaved. Better to die first than live as another's puppet.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githyanki Ideals

table.caption: Githyanki Bonds
rows: There is no greater duty than to serve the Revered Queen.
Humanity thrives only because we conquered the illithids. Therefore, what is theirs is ours.
Without battle, life has no purpose.
Life is but a spark in the dark. We all go dark, but those who dare can burn bright.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githyanki Bonds

table.caption: Githyanki Flaws
rows: Hunger and thirst are unbearable pains to me.
I can't see a non-githyanki as a real threat.
I follow orders, regardless of their implications.
I start projects but never finish them.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githyanki Flaws

table.caption: Githzerai Personality Traits
rows: All energy must be expended to a useful end. Frivolity is the first step to defeat.
Patience in all things. The first step in any venture is the most treacherous.
Emotions are a trap, meant to weaken the intellect and disturb the nerves. Pay them no heed.
Begin only those tasks you will finish. Strike only that which you will kill.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githzerai Personality Traits

table.caption: Githzerai Ideals
rows: Faith. Zerthimon shall return, and I will be worthy to walk beside him.
Courage. The mind can master anything if it is unfettered by fear.
Duty. My people survive only because those like me place their needs above our own.
Freedom. No strong soul should be enslaved. Better to die first than live as another's puppet.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githzerai Ideals

table.caption: Githzerai Bonds
rows: Zerthimon provides an example of conduct that I strive to duplicate.
Menyar-Ag hand-picked me for my duties, and I will never betray the trust he showed in me.
Vlaakith and her toadies will be defeated, if not by me then by those who follow in my footsteps.
I will not rest until the last elder brain is destroyed.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githzerai Bonds

table.caption: Githzerai Flaws
rows: I see githyanki machinations behind every threat.
I believe in the supremacy of the gith and that githzerai and githyanki will align to rule the multiverse.
I respond to even minor threats with overwhelming displays of force.
The next time I laugh will be the first. The sound of merriment takes me to the edge of violence.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githzerai Flaws

table.caption: Halfling Personality Traits
rows: You try to start every day with a smile.
Why walk when you can skip?
You make up songs about your friends that praise them for their bravery and intelligence.
You are extremely cautious, always on the lookout for monsters and other dangers.
You always see the bright side of a situation.
You like to collect mementos of your travels.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Personality Traits

table.caption: Halfling Ideals
rows: Courage. You seek to prove that the bravest heart can be contained within the smallest of packages.
Companionship. You're pretty sure you can be friends with anyone or anything.
Hopeful. You will live a life of adventure and have many stories to tell.
Protective. You make sure to shelter the innocent.
Honest. Your mother told you to always tell the truth.
Excitement. Can you steal the sleeping giant's pouch? Of course you can!
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Ideals

table.caption: Halfling Bonds
rows: The safety of your village is worth any sacrifice.
Nothing is more valuable than friendship and family.
You are following your own path through life. No one can tell you what to do.
You have a special heirloom that you never part with.
You won't rob or hurt those who are weaker or less fortunate than you.
No matter how small you may be, you won't back down from a bully.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Bonds

table.caption: Halfling Flaws
rows: You can't resist poking your nose where it doesn't belong.
You are very fidgety. Sitting still is a major challenge.
You can't pass up a good time.
You hate to miss a meal, and become grumpy and illtempered when you must.
You are fascinated by shiny things and can't help "borrowing" them.
You never settle for just one slice when you can have the whole cake.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Flaws

table.caption: Reasons for Adventuring
rows: Peeling taters and herding goats all the time wasn't your cup of tea.
You fell asleep on a raft one day and woke up near a human city. You were so thrilled with the strange sights and tasty food that you never turned back.
What started off as simple pumpkin pillaging from nearby farms turned into your becoming a wandering rogue for hire.
You talked to a nice faerie in the woods, and all of a sudden you were a thousand miles from home.
Your village elder told you so many stories about being a rogue in an adventuring party that you couldn't resist the urge to try doing it yourself.
A friend dared you to jump on the back of a sleeping horse, which turned out to be a pegasus, and your life hasn't slowed down since.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Reasons for Adventuring

table.caption: Gnome Deities
rows: Golden signet ring with six pointed star
footnotes: *Appears in {@i Xanathar's Guide to Everything}
**Appears in {@i Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide}
table.name: Gnome Gods; Gnome Deities

table.caption: Gnome Personality Traits
rows: Once you develop a liking for something, you quickly become obsessed with it.
You live life like a leaf on the breeze, letting it take you where it will.
The world is a miraculous place, and you are fascinated by everything in it.
You study your friends and take notes about how they act, jotting down things they say that interest you.
Your curiosity is so wide-ranging that you sometimes have trouble concentrating on any one thing.
You like to make little objects and creatures out of twigs or bits of metal and give them to friends.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Personality Traits

table.caption: Gnome Ideals
rows: Love. You love little (and big) critters and go out of your way to help them.
Curiosity. You can't stand an unsolved mystery or an unopened door.
Knowledge. You are interested in everything. You never know when what you learn will come in handy.
Compassion. You never turn down a plea for help.
Helpfulness. Whether you see a broken contraption or a broken heart, you have to try to fix it.
Excellence. You strive to be and do the best you can.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Ideals

table.caption: Gnome Bonds
rows: You pledge to bring something of immense value back to your burrow.
Anything of great quality and artisanship is to be protected, respected, and cared for.
Kobolds have caused you and your people nothing but trouble. You will avenge those wrongs.
You are searching for your lost love.
You will recover a keepsake stolen from your clan.
You are willing to take risks to learn about the world.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Bonds

table.caption: Gnome Flaws
rows: You embody the typical absent-minded professor. If you could forget where you put your head, you would.
You prefer to hide during a fight.
There is no difference between what you think and what you say.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Flaws

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Nation.} Jestem oddany sprawie odbudowy imperium Benalii.
{@b Peace.} Życie może prawdziwie rozkwitać tylko wtedy, gdy ustaną wojny i spory.
{@b Protection.} Będę również chronił osoby, które mają mniej szczęścia, przed deprawacją ze strony bogatych i silnych.
{@b Hope.} Świat wychodzi z długiej rozpaczy i potrzebuje każdej cząstki inspiracji, jaką możemy zaoferować.
{@b Honor.} Jeśli zhańbię siebie, przynoszę hańbę mojemu bóstwu, mojemu narodowi i mojej rodzinie.
{@b Solidarity.} Razem jesteśmy silniejsi niż ktokolwiek z nas w pojedynkę.
table.name: Heroes of Benalia; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: Jestem związany z jednym z Siedmiu Wielkich Domów i przedkładam jego interesy nad wszystkie inne.
Z moimi członkami Gwiezdnego Klanu łączą mnie bliższe więzy niż z moją rodziną.
Posiadam broń lub zbroję używaną przez sławnego przodka.
Jestem zakochany w członku innego wielkiego domu.
Wierzę, że jestem ostatnim spadkobiercą wielkiego domu, który został utracony.
Majątek mojej rodziny leży w gruzach, a ja chcę go odbudować.
table.name: Heroes of Benalia; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Benalish Quests
rows: Obroń osadę górniczą w Górach Czerwonego Żelaza przed najazdami koboldów Crookshank.
Nawiąż handel lub wynegocjuj traktat z minotaurami w górach Hurloon.
{@action Help} rozstrzygnij spór między dwoma Wielkimi Domami.
Przekonaj Radę Siedmiu, aby wysłała pomoc wojskową do jednego z siedmiu domów.
Założenie kolonii handlowej w niegościnnej krainie.
Odkryj zdrajcę lub kultystę Kliki wśród Siedmiu Wielkich Domów.
table.name: Benalish Quests

table.caption: Benalish Sites
rows: Zaginiona świątynia Szeoltun należąca do sponsorowanego przez państwo Kościoła Angelfire
Ukryta górska jaskinia, w której znajduje się starożytny relikt Thranów
Tajna piwnica głęboko pod Nową Benalią, która służyła jako miejsce spotkań zdelegalizowanego Kościoła Serra w czasach panowania Imperium Szeoltun.
Wrak phyrexiańskiego statku portalowego, od dawna zarośnięty przez naturę
Pozostałości zamku, który pogrążył się w bagnie podczas Lata Soli
Otwarte pole usiane ruinami, które pozostały po dawno minionej wojnie
Serrańska katedra spadła na ziemię ze swojego miejsca na niebie
table.name: Benalish Sites

table.caption: Benalish Villains
rows: Pewien gorliwy wojownik chce poprowadzić armię na wojnę przeciwko Keldowi.
Lider domu chce, aby jego dom stał się Domem Najwyższym na kilka lat przed terminem.
Podejrzliwy szlachcic łączy siły z płomiennym serrańskim kapłanem, próbując wykorzenić z mieszkańców korupcję i piętno Kliki, przy czym wielu niewinnych zostaje rannych.
Gorąca głowa avena żąda, by jego lud natychmiast uzyskał reprezentację w Radzie Siedmiu.
Pewien pobożny szlachcic dąży do podporządkowania całego Kościoła Serra kontroli Benalish, łącząc kościół i państwo w teokratyczne imperium.
Jeden z członków Rady Siedmiu od dawna żywi urazę do drugiego.
Skórzana wiedźma z Morasu Caligo rzuca klątwę na pobliski obszar.
Ważny szlachcic ulega wpływom doradcy powiązanego z Kabiną i nie wiedząc o tym, realizuje jej plany.
table.name: Benalish Villains

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Law.} "Prawo musi być przestrzegane. Jeśli węzły porządku zostaną rozluźnione, chaos się rozleje." (Pieśń o wszystkim, Canto 167)
{@b Grace.} "Łaska musi być zachowana. Jeśli nici Łaski zostaną rozplątane, jej projekt zostanie utracony, a wraz z nim ludzie." (Pieśń o wszystkich, Canto 167)
{@b Duty.} "Obowiązek musi być przestrzegany. Jeśli rama obowiązku zostanie złamana, nikt nie będzie tkał tkaniny życia." (Pieśń o wszystkim, Canto 167)
{@b Reason.} "Rozsądek musi zostać zachowany. Jeśli sieć Rozumu zostanie rozplątana, szaleństwo ucieknie." (Pieśń o wszystkim, Canto 167)
{@b Truth.} "Prawda musi zostać uwolniona. Jeśli skrzydła Prawdy zostaną podcięte, głosy zamilkną." (Pieśń wszystkich, Canto 167)
{@b The Four Virtues.} Sztuka, dyskurs, wolność i pokój są życiem ducha, tak jak duch jest życiem ciała.
table.name: Heroes of Serra; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: Zrobiłbym wszystko, aby chronić katedrę Serry w Sursi.
Przysiągłem pomagać Lyrze Dawnbringer w ochronie Benalii.
Regularnie pielgrzymuję do Świątyni Serry w Epityr w Nowej Argowii, najstarszego czynnego miejsca kultu Serran na świecie.
Zachowuję wiele starych tradycji nomadów z Daru lub aven, czcząc Serrę jako Przodka.
Mniejszy anioł stał się dla mnie bliskim przyjacielem i powiernikiem.
Myślę, że witraż w moim świętym symbolu pochodzi z Królestwa Serry, zanim ta sztuczna płaszczyzna upadła. Przywołaj boską Magali Villeneuve
table.name: Heroes of Serra; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Serran Quests
rows: Act as an impartial mediator between Benalia and Keld (or two other powers of the region).
Tame a mesa pegasus from the lands of Sursi on the east coast of southern Aerona, near the great Cathedral of Serra.
Protect a peaceful community of Serran monks who have come under attack (from without or within).
Answer the call of a barbarian chieftain who wants to hear the message of Serra and consider conversion.
Find an angel who has disappeared in a dangerous land.
Retrieve as much artwork as possible from a ruined Serran church—whether an ancient site or one that was only recently destroyed.
table.name: Serran Quests

table.caption: Serran Sites
rows: A majestic Serran cathedral floating in the air (perhaps above Benalia City)
A small monastery surrounded by pastoral farmland or quiet woods
A remote temple maintained and inhabited by an order of knights
An ancient ruin preserving some foreign aspect of Serra worship (such as Otarian devotion to the Ancestor)
A sacred cave where a new angel was (or is about to be) birthed
An abandoned missionary post destroyed by hostile natives of the area
A chapel within a castle or palace beset by intrigue
A roadside shrine where miracles have occurred lately
A community devoted to the spiritual path of the artistic life
The scorched site of an angel's death
table.name: Serran Sites

table.caption: Serran Villains
rows: A Serran priest believes that no one is beyond redemption, and is shielding a murderous villain from the law in the hope that they will repent.
A naive angel keeps sending Serran knights on deadly quests against impossible odds.
An aven priest wants to lead other aven away from the Serran church and revive the worship of the Ancestor, but without the accretion of Serran tradition.
A warrior chieftain claims to have converted to Serra worship and launches a crusade in the church's name—but this is a thinly veiled excuse to conquer a neighboring territory.
A Serra angel has been corrupted by the demonic power of the Cabal.
A community of Serran monks has been somehow led astray into the contemplation of an ancient, nameless evil.
An old priest grows bitter with grief and frustration, convinced that their life's work has been a waste—and turns to the pursuit of revenge.
A priest twists the teachings of Serra to paint a certain group of innocent people as evil, and to call for their extermination.
table.name: Serran Villains

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
colLabels: Ideal 1 Teaching. Tolaria is a school where the world's most promising wizards can learn from masters of their craft.
rows: {@b Restoration.} Every day, lost knowledge is regained and devastated lands are renewed. It's our duty to use our magic to help this effort continue.
{@b Responsibility.} Following the philosophy of the Academy's original headmaster, Barrin, I am dedicated to keeping powerful magic out of the hands of those who would abuse it.
{@b Innovation.} Like the ancient artificer Urza, I believe progress comes through bold and radical new design.
{@b Progress.} Like the kind Tolarian chancellor Rayne, I believe progress comes through careful iteration and measured experimentation.
{@b Self-Improvement.} Like Urza's brother Mishra, I believe that the improvement of the body through genetic and artificial modification leads to the general improvement of humanity.
table.name: Heroes of Tolaria; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I have a former student I'm convinced will do great things—for good or for evil.
I bought a cheap curio from a secondhand store, and I was expelled when it caused a magical accident.
I've gotten tangled up with illegal research by way of the Shadow Academy, which uses interdimensional spaces to facilitate communication.
By virtue of a parent who is emeritus faculty, I have the rare privilege of citizenship in one of the Academies.
One of my old teachers has a knack for contacting me at the strangest times.
I believe that my genetic makeup was manipulated for some unknown purpose.
table.name: Heroes of Tolaria; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Tolarian Quests
rows: Retrieve a unique magical device from the ruins of a catastrophe—but be careful, because the device might well have been what caused the catastrophe.
Copy a spell from the spellbook of a mysterious or hostile wizard.
Find a way to reverse the effect of a disastrous magical experiment.
Decide what to do with a notebook you found, which is full of forbidden research into Phyrexian transformation.
Steal a magical object that's on display in a museum on campus in order to uncover its secrets or harness the energy it holds.
Try to reproduce the research of a wizard who has gone missing, without ending up missing yourself.
table.name: Tolarian Quests

table.caption: Tolarian Sites
rows: An underwater ruin left behind by a terrible catastrophe
The trap-filled tower of an eccentric, suspicious, and powerful wizard
An arcane workshop or laboratory filled with inexplicable and undoubtedly dangerous devices
A laboratory where research was once conducted—or still is conducted—on living monsters
A small stronghold drifting through the air or across the ocean
A library hidden in an extradimensional space
An ancient Phyrexian or Thran artifact, now overgrown by nature
A crater where a meteorite or a flying vessel crashed to the ground centuries ago
A newly discovered ruin from an ancient era of advanced magical technology
An area that has just returned after being phased out of the flow of time
table.name: Tolarian Sites

table.caption: Tolarian Villains
rows: A member of the Society of Mishra seeks to be transformed into a biomechanical demon of fused metal and flesh.
A Gathist involved in illegal genetic experimentation seeks to create a race of supersoldiers to forge a nation through conquest.
A collector steals magical items and treats them like valuable works of art.
A professor of temporal studies seeks to hasten the process of rebirth and renewal—by shifting the entire world backward in time to its "glory days."
An archaeologist has discovered an ancient magical weapon that caused untold devastation, and is trying to find a use for it.
A professor has imprisoned students in a tower and compelled them to participate in genetic, biomechanical, psychological, or other research.
An artificer built a golem that has achieved its own evil consciousness, and which seeks to better understand living creatures through vivisection.
A misguided master wizard is trying to trace a single "true Tolarian ancestry," so as to prevent those who don't belong to that human bloodline from entering the Academies and studying magic.
table.name: Tolarian Villains

table.caption: Vodalian Quests
rows: Retrieve an artifact from ancient Vodalia that is kept in a Tolarian museum.
Sabotage a Cabal port on Walassa, where ships set sail for Aerona carrying Cabal cultists.
Protect a peripatetic member of the Society of the Conch on a journey to learn about your native culture.
Defend a surface port loyal to Vodalia from a land-based attack.
Find a pirate captain who slaughtered a group of merfolk, but who has not been seen in the Voda Sea since.
Retrieve an item of historical significance from a Keldon fortress.
table.name: Vodalian Quests

table.caption: Vodalian Sites
rows: A shipwreck on the ocean floor
A surface-built city that sank in a magical catastrophe
A city built on the back of an enormous leviathan
A palace in a coral reef
A ship crossing the Voda Sea
A well-preserved Thran or Phyrexian artifact deep underwater
A sea cave on an island shore
A beach where merfolk trade with surface-dwellers
table.name: Vodalian Sites

table.caption: Vodalian Villains
rows: A hotheaded young military officer, part of the Akula Current, plans to escalate conflict with a surface port in hopes of eventually annexing the port.
A notable aristocrat decides that no ships may cross their territory—and sinks a merchant vessel to emphasize the point.
A mage manipulates coastal waters, causing saltwater to back up rivers, beachfront land to flood, and docks to be swept away by the waves.
A group of merfolk turn to piracy, angering both surface-dwellers and other merfolk.
A trickster lures sailors into shipwrecks, then either takes them captive or watches them drown.
A spellcaster calls up horrific monsters from the ocean depths to attack a coastal town.
A general's crusade against homarids is driving those creatures into human-occupied coastal lands.
A wizard seeks the Golgothian Sylex—the artifact that destroyed the island of Argoth and launched the ice age—in hopes of destroying all land on Dominaria.
table.name: Vodalian Villains

table.caption: Cabal Sites
rows: A small shrine to Belzenlok located near a major city
A basement room in a busy town where Cabal cultists meet
A ruined library that cultists are excavating, hoping to find magic items to decorate Belzenlok's throne
A half-collapsed temple in a dark swamp
An ancient war machine whose power the Cabal is trying to harness
A small outpost of Grimnant knights
A deep sinkhole with whispering echoes emerging from the darkness
A secret fortress in the mountains
The house of an aristocrat who has joined the Cabal
table.name: Cabal Sites

table.caption: Cabal Villains
rows: A Grimnant commander leads raids along a nation's borders to sow chaos and confusion.
A Cabal assassin starts killing the firstborn children of prominent families.
A dementist unleashes formless horrors of nightmare upon a defenseless town.
A cult leader sends a miasma out from a hidden temple to pollute and corrupt the surrounding forest.
A Cabal cultist has infiltrated a ruling council or prominent church body and begins destroying it from within.
A dementist is controlling the mind of a monster, sending it to rampage through an area of farms and villages.
A Cabal infiltrator sows discord among various factions within a larger organization (different Serran orders, different Benalish houses, and so forth).
Cabal infiltrators detonate nightmare devices designed to cause as much terror as possible, striking in highly populated areas at unpredictable times.
table.name: Cabal Villains

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Self-Reliance.} I don't wear or use anything I haven't made myself. You can't count on anyone else in this world.
{@b Future.} I believe a true Twilight still awaits the Keldon faithful, when our fallen heroes will rise up to fight alongside us as we conquer the world.
{@b Pragmatism.} No ancestors are coming to save us—we are our only hope.
{@b Coin.} I will happily fight for those too weak to defend themselves, if they pay me enough.
{@b Freedom.} The so-called "new Keld" is too safe, too controlled. The fire in Keldon blood demands warfare and pillage.
{@b Keld.} I am Keldon, and that is all that matters. I seek the glory and prosperity of my people above all else.
table.name: Bard or Cleric; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I fight to prove myself worthy of my glorious ancestors.
Even away from Keld, my loyalty is to my warlord and the rest of my warhost.
I'm inexplicably drawn to the sacred peak called the Mountain.
My favorite weapon is one I forged from the broken weapons of my enemies.
I want to be a warlord someday, and I won't stop there.
I had a dear mentor from another nation who taught me my skills.
table.name: Bard or Cleric; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Keld Quests
rows: Persuade a Benalish house to abandon a colony newly established on Keld's soil.
Carry an urgent message from one warlord to another across a dangerous area.
Convince a wayward warlord to obey an overseer's orders before the situation escalates into full-on rebellion.
Undermine the loyalty of a rebellious warlord's warhost, thus depriving the warlord of power.
Kill a monster lurking in the mountains.
Fend off attacks by frost giants from the north.
table.name: Keld Quests

table.caption: Keld Sites
rows: At the foot of the Keldons' sacred Mountain
At the entrance to the Keldon Necropolis, where great figures of the past are interred
A tower formed from strange black ice
A forest clearing where the air is cold enough to freeze your breath in your mouth
A plateau where carved megaliths are erected
A camp with dozens of round tents
At the peak of the Keldons' sacred Mountain
table.name: Keld Sites

table.caption: Keld Villains
rows: A warlord leads an attack on a different warhost.
A doyen advises several different warlords to provoke conflicts with Benalia, believing that a full-scale war will trigger the true Twilight.
A shaman has secretly made an alliance with the frost giants of the northern wastes to help overthrow the grand warlord.
A shaman dabbles in the hated arts of necromancy, hoping to reproduce the false Twilight caused by the Phrexians.
A frost giant shaman brings a nightmarish winter down over Keld, and it begins spreading farther south.
A warlord leads a host in longboats to the Benalish isle of Avenant.
A warlord directly challenges the authority of the grand warlord, hoping to take her place.
A warlord kills the grand warlord and starts transforming Keld back into the land of bloodthirsty raiders it once was.
table.name: Keld Villains

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Riashil Pacifism.} To live at peace with nature, we must first learn to live at peace with each other.
{@b Staprion Defiance.} Those who cross lines must be put in their place.
{@b Loridalh Interdependence.} I am my own master, but I am strongest when I work as part of the web of all life.
{@b Kelfae Flexibility.} The search for stability—whether in a swaying treetop or in the turmoil of life—is fruitless.
{@b Jubilar Remembrance.} The sacrifice of those who were exterminated in the Phyrexian Invasion must be remembered, and their stories retold.
{@b Basiphem Pride.} Because we are strong, it is our responsibility to aid the rest of the forest where we can.
{@b Hedressel Holiness.} We must maintain our distance—culturally and physically—from other peoples to maintain our connections to the wood.
{@b Ruadach Openness.} We must open ourselves to new cultures, new peoples, and new ideas, or we will rot like a fallen log.
table.name: Fighter or Ranger; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I could always count on my mother to give me a good bonk on the head if I did something foolish. (Riashil)
I will have my revenge against the Cabal for the harm they have done to my kin. (Staprion)
One of the twelve tallest emergent trees in Llanowar is the dearest place to me in all the world. (Loridalh)
I was bonded to a kavu at birth. (Kelfae)
I survived the Phyrexian Invasion over three hundred years ago, and I will never forget the faces of those who died. (Jubilar)
My family carries the shame of failing to protect Llanowar from the Phyrexian Invasion, and I will stop at nothing to undo that shame. (Basiphem)
I spent a year in Hedressel, and I would give my life to defend that holy place. (Hedressel)
I left my family rather than endure the grief of losing them. (Ruadach)
table.name: Fighter or Ranger; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Llanowar Quests
rows: Find the source of orc raids in the Ironcrown Mountains.
Retrieve something caught in the web of an enormous spider.
Carry a message to a Benalish city—about diplomacy, trade, matters of the heart, or anything else.
Track down an interloper who managed to escape punishment for crimes against the forest (perhaps even trespassing in Hedressel).
Dispose of a newly uncovered piece of Phyrexian wreckage.
Plant a seed from Llanowar in the Whispering Woods or another distant forest.
table.name: Llanowar Quests

table.caption: Llanowar Sites
rows: Inside a giant tree that has strangely begun to rot from the inside
At the top of an emergent tree, where magical flowers grow
Nestled among the roots of one of the oldest and largest trees in the forest
A temple hollowed out from a huge branch of a still-living tree
A statue of the elf hero Eladamri, situated in the middle of a placid forest clearing
A network of rope bridges connecting canopy trees
A sinister-looking tower made from a dead tree
An enormous patch of mushrooms that gets larger every day
An anthill, termite nest, or wasp nest that's larger than a grand temple
table.name: Llanowar Sites

table.caption: Llanowar Villains
rows: A zealous druid wants to drive the humans and half-elves out of Ruadach.
A pragmatist thinks the old druidic traditions are holding the elves back from greatness, and seeks to destroy Hedressel or Molimo (or both).
A knight of the Steel Leaf tries to stir up war with Benalia, in order to have an excuse to slaughter the humans.
A druid uses ancient necromancy to poison a stream supplying water to a Benalish town.
A Staprion warrior believes the pacifist Riashil are traitors to the elves, and tries to goad them into fighting.
An elf has bred a giant kavu intended to topple trees and destroy elfhames.
A necromancer wants to use the spirits of the elven dead that are said to guard Hedressel to destroy the elves entirely.
A leader of the Order of the Steel Leaf is in league with the Cabal, and tries to undermine the Staprion offensive against that order.
table.name: Llanowar Villains

table.caption: Ravnica Currency
table.name: Currency: Zibs and Zinos; Ravnica Currency

table.caption: Party Makeup
rows: {@b One-Guild Party}. Wybierz gildię i zapoznaj się z jej opisem w {@book chapter 2|GGR|2}, aby poznać sugestie dotyczące budowania wokół niej stronnictwa.

{@b Classic Party}. Kleryk z Boros lub Selesnya (domena życia), wojownik z Azorius lub Boros (archetyp bohatera), łotrzyk z Dimir lub Golgari (archetyp złodzieja), czarodziej z Boros lub Izzet (szkoła przywoływania).
{@b Law and Order Party}. Kleryk z Boros, wojownik z Azorius, czarodziej z Azorius, strażnik z Boros
{@b Mad Science Party}. Symicki druid, Izzetowy wojownik, Izzetowy czarodziej, Symicki mnich
{@b Skulkers Party}. Druid z Golgari, wojownik lub strażnik z Golgari, łotrzyk lub mnich z Dimiru, czarodziej z Dimiru
{@b Chaos Party}. Gruul druid, Gruul barbarzyńca, {@creature Rakdos|GGR} czarnoksiężnik, {@creature Rakdos|GGR} łotrzyk
{@b Nature Party}. Druid z Selesnya, Barbarzyńca z Gruulu, Czarodziej z Simic lub Bard z Selesnya, Łotrzyk z Golgari.
{@b Benevolent Party}. Ukończenie Kleryka, Paladyn z Boros, Czarodziej z Azorius, Ukończenie Barda
table.name: Building a Party; Party Makeup

table.caption: Common Cause
rows: {@b Cellmates}. Postacie są więźniami w więzieniu Azorius, obozie Gruul lub klatce {@creature Rakdos|GGR}.
{@b Greater Threat}. Bohaterowie walczą ze sobą, kiedy atakuje szalejący wurm.
{@b Sudden Danger}. Bohaterowie są uwięzieni razem przez otwierające się zapadlisko, zawalający się budynek lub eksplodujące laboratorium.
{@b Dream Team}. Dziwny sen prowadzi każdą z postaci do tego samego celu.
{@b Lost Together}. Bohaterowie są beznadziejnie zagubieni w nieznanej im części miasta.
{@b Detente}. Na polecenie przywódców swoich gildii bohaterowie muszą współpracować, aby wykonać tajną misję.
{@b Common Foe}. Złoczyńca to wspólny wróg dla wszystkich bohaterów.
{@b Do or Die}. Wszyscy bohaterowie próbują zapobiec katastrofie, jaką jest wybuch wojny między gildiami.
table.name: Building a Party; Common Cause
